universal_mapping.variables: [Reserved: no mutable state in data files]

constants._reserved: JSON data files ARE constants for code. All values defined in the data sections are static configuration that code reads. The file itself is the constant definition.

variables._reserved: JSON data files don't hold mutable runtime state. The file is immutable data - any changes require file modification and reload.

type_behaviors._reserved: JSON data files have no executable behaviors. The file is declarative data - behaviors live in the code that reads it.

_omission_guide.rule: Unlike METADATA (where sections can be omitted), ALL six SETUP sections must be present for structural alignment.

guidance.constants: [Reserved: Data files ARE constants for code]
guidance.variables: [Reserved: Data files don't hold mutable state]
guidance.related_files: Required - documents code handler and docs
guidance.usage_behavior: Required - shows loading pattern and validation

sections.1_configuration_structure_map: Document the organization pattern and JSON conventions
sections.2_helpers_utilities: [Reserved: Declarative config - JSON files don't have helper functions]
sections.3_configuration_content: The actual JSON data keys and nested structures

1_configuration_structure_map.organization_pattern: Core data first (type, version), then domain-specific sections
1_configuration_structure_map.json_features: Key-value pairs, nested objects, arrays. No trailing commas. UTF-8 encoding.

2_helpers_utilities._reserved: JSON files are declarative data. No helper functions - code consuming the JSON handles transformations.

_body._note: Section 3 (Configuration Content) is the actual data below this _body block

4_error_handling._reserved: JSON files validate at parse time. The JSON parser (json.Unmarshal, JSON.parse) validates syntax and structure. Code handles semantic validation.

5_public_interface._reserved: JSON files don't export functions. The 'interface' is the keys themselves. Document key names and types in _metadata or schema.

_omission_guide.rule: ALL five BODY sections must be present for structural alignment

guidance.1_configuration_structure_map: Required - documents organization and JSON features

group_1_validation.1_validation: How to verify JSON file correctness
group_1_validation.3_cleanup: [Reserved: JSON files have no cleanup needs]

group_2_documentation.5_security: [Reserved: covered in code that loads data]

common_issues.parse_error: Check for trailing commas, missing quotes, bracket mismatches

2_execution._reserved: JSON files don't execute. They are declarative data read by consuming applications.

3_cleanup._reserved: JSON files have no cleanup needs. Static data files with no side effects.

4_performance._reserved: JSON parse time is negligible. Cache parsed data if repeated access needed.

5_security._reserved: Security is handled in loading code. Validate values before using them.

6_dependencies._reserved: See METADATA for parser and consumer information.

7_integration.note: JSON data is immutable at runtime - changes require file modification

8_known_issues._reserved: Template file - no known issues to document.

10_see_also._reserved: See METADATA and standards/code/4-block/ for documentation.

safe_to_modify: Update values within documented valid ranges
Add new keys (if code supports them)
modify_with_care: Changing value types (may cause parse errors)
never_modify: Required keys without updating consumer code

12_closing_note.principle: JSON embodies clarity through structure - explicit, typed, universal format.

_omission_guide.rule: ALL thirteen CLOSING sections must be present for structural alignment
